#+TITLE: If Harry disappeared from the Wizarding world when he was a baby, how did they know that his scar was important and its shape ? Was it Dumbledore, Hagrid or Pomfrey that blabbed?

* If Harry disappeared from the Wizarding world when he was a baby, how did they know that his scar was important and its shape ? Was it Dumbledore, Hagrid or Pomfrey that blabbed?

:PROPERTIES:
:Author: Deathcrow
:Score: 21
:DateUnix: 1522079202.0
:DateShort: 2018-Mar-26
:END:

***** I don't know if telling Hagrid about the Stone did anything for Quirrel and the Wonder Turban. They were already after the Stone, knew that Dumbledore was friends with Flamel, and that the Stone had just been moved from Gringotts; so when Dumbledore said (all on his own) that something very special was hidden in the Third Floor Corridor, there was little more Hagrid could have said to convince Voldemort to go a'looking.

Either way, on this issue, I fail to see /why/ Dumbledore would want people to know about the Lightning Scar. Blood protection aside, part of the point of keeping Harry with the Dursleys (as stated by Dumbledore himself) is to make sure Harry isn't recognized and swarmed throughout his childhood either by overenthusiastic fans, or by resentful Voldemort sympathizers. Informing the whole world of Harry's distinguishing feature seems counterproductive to keeping him hidden.
:PROPERTIES:
:Author: Achille-Talon

*** So....

I had always understood that those "random people" were actually Order of the Phoenix members or people Dumbledore trusted to "keep an eye" on young Harry at times. It would make sense that since its just blood wards, and there are still Death Eaters out and about, that Harry would have had "watchers" most of his life. Plus it would be odd for random Wizards to show up in his muggle life knowing who he is already, scar or otherwise.

This is part of why I have always been suspicious of Dumbledore not being more aware of what went on at Privet Drive between the Dursleys and Harry.

******* But how was he identified ?

The last time he was seen, he was younger than 15 months and not a lot of people have seen him, since the Potters had to go into hiding after he was born.

So the only people that did see him, had to be order members or close friends. He couldn't have met many of those in my opinion.

The only one, who we know about he met was Diggle, who recognized him immediatly and I do not think he saw baby Harry very often. So it had to be the scar.

It is pretty hard to identify a child based on how he looked as a baby/toddler, especially if you don't know said child might be standing in front of you.

********* I found a solution! If Hagrid takes Harry to Molly Weasley, then not only does it fill in time, but it explains how and why Harry could 'fall asleep over Bristol' on a journey to Surrey of all places. Canon does not support a journey to Hogwarts, because then, why Bristol? It's in the south west, Surrey is in the south east, Hogwarts is waaay up north in Scotland. But Devon is in the south west too.

******** He was dropped off that same day though, or that night(1st)....though looking back there is no text evidence saying that Hagrid took Harry anywhere else at all, and actually it sounds as if he drove to the Dursleys straight-away which timeline-wise doesn't make much sense. Saying that Harry fell asleep while they were flying over Bristol, and that he got Harry out of the house right before the Muggles started swarming the house. He's talking to Dumbledore as if Dumbledore had not yet seen Harry nor been updated on him.

So I think it's more a canon mistake of timing on Rowlings part than Harry actually having gone /anywhere/ first. Or Hagrid took a very indirect route...

:PROPERTIES:
:Author: bisonburgers
:Score: 2
:DateUnix: 1522105739.0
:DateShort: 2018-Mar-27
:END:


** The people we know saw him between him receiving the scar and reentering magical society:

- Dumbledore
- McGonagall
- Hagrid

Snape, Riddle, and Sirius Black are also candidates for having seen the scar.

Hagrid has difficulties keeping secrets, and he had custody of Harry for some amount of time off-screen (possibly as much as a day, since there's about 24 hours between Voldemort's downfall and Harry arriving at the Dursleys). Riddle wasn't in any condition to spread rumors. Snape isn't the sort to indulge in rumor-mongering. Black was seeking revenge too assiduously to spend time telling people about a scar. McGonagall might have told as part of the Hogwarts gossip scene. Dumbledore could have spread the information to build up hype about Harry, but he said he wanted to give Harry a normal childhood, so it would be kind of weird.

There's a tongue-in-cheek fan theory that Hagrid spent that time visiting every magical pub from John o' Groats to Falmouth with Harry in tow. My personal take on it is that Hagrid just wanted a pint, but as soon as he entered a pub and mentioned what happened, everyone was so busy celebrating and making a big deal of Harry that they forgot to get Hagrid his drink. So naturally he went to the next pub over, but he didn't manage to get a drink until after he dropped off Harry.
:PROPERTIES:
:Score: 3
:DateUnix: 1522088157.0
:DateShort: 2018-Mar-26
:END:

*** It's an interesting theory. Tho if true than it's mostly his fault Harry is that famous. After all, if there is no other source of info on the initial gossip, it means that Snape was the one to say that Harry vanquished Moldyshorts. And then years later he complains about his popularity. OH the irony XD For all they knew Voldy and Lily could have simultaneously defeated one another.

That said, I'm not sure Snape would have so easily identified the scar. After all the AK is supposed to leave no marks, even if he had detected some dark magic from the soul fragment I'm not so sure he would have quickly found out the whats and hows. Especially since at the time he was just a few years out of Hogwarts. I doubt he was that well versed at the time...
